Quick start Guide¶

Contents

  • Quick start Guide
    • Step 1: Create your option file
      • REQUIRED parameters
    • Step 2: Run it

Step 1: Create your option file¶

Like ORBS, ORCS uses option files to load all the parameters. Here’s en example.

# option_file.orc

## ORCS option file

INCLUDE /Path/to/ORBS_option_file.opt
DIRSPEC /Path/to/spectrum_folder
WAVENUMBER 1
WAVE_CALIB 0
APOD 2.0
LINES [NII]6548,Halpha,[NII]6583,[SII]6716,[SII]6731
COV_LINES 1,2,1,1,1
OBJECT_VELOCITY 180
POLY_ORDER 0
ROI 165,260,155,255 
SKY_REG sky.reg 
CALIBMAP /Path/to/calibration_laser_map.fits

REQUIRED parameters¶

INCLUDE Include ORBS option file.

DIRSPEC Path to the spectrum directory. This directory can
be created from a full 3d cube by using the ‘orb-unstack’ function of ORB.
WAVENUMBER Must be 0 if the cube axis is in wavelength or 1
if the cube axis is in wavenumber.
WAVE_CALIB Must be 0 if the cube is not wavelength
calibrated and 1 if the cube is wavelength calibrated.

APOD Give the apodization (1.0 for unapodized cube)

LINES Emission Lines names, enter an integer or a float to
use a non_recorded emission line. See orb.core.Lines to get a list of the available lines.
COV_LINES Covarying lines. Give the same number to the lines
from the same atom, or more generally for the lines of the same velocity.

OBJECT_VELOCITY Object velocity in km.s-1

POLY_ORDER Order of the polynomial used to fit continuum

ROI Region of interest : Xmin,Xmax,Ymin,Ymax. Must be integers.

SKY_REG Sky regions ds9 file path (Regions border must be in
pixel coordinates, region shape can be a circle, a box or a polygon)

CALIBMAP Calibration map path

DATE Observation date (UT)

HOUR_UT Observation hour (UT)

Step 2: Run it¶

orcs option_file.orc
